comments.author: javad@standardcon.com
comments.creator: javad@standardcon.com
comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:6.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0
Build ID: 20110811165603

Steps to reproduce:

we use reply, to any mail, which has defined subject


Actual results:

when we use reply, the top line says write:(no subject), even if there is a subject line in email to which we are replying.
The issue was in previous version also


Expected results:

presumeanly the subject from the original mail should have ben picked up may be with Re: as prefix??

comments.raw_text: I see this too, in Thunderbird 11 on Linux. The compose window title is "Write: (no subject)", when replying to or forwarding an email with a subject. Same in safe mode.
